DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Hematologic Method Recurrent Disease Assessment Yes No Character Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the clinical / hematologic assessment was used to assess the disease relapse.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Hematologic Method Recurrent Disease Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal._The return of a disease after a period of remission._The act of judging the value, significance, or extent of something.

Property.preferredDefinition: the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
